Package com.strongjoshua.console

Interface Console

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractConsole, GUIConsole, HeadlessConsole
public interface Console
A simple console that allows live logging, and live execution of methods, from within an application. Please see the GitHub Repository for more information.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    UNLIMITED_ENTRIES
    Use to set the amount of entries to be stored to unlimited.

  • Field Details

    • UNLIMITED_ENTRIES

      static final int UNLIMITED_ENTRIES
      Use to set the amount of entries to be stored to unlimited.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • setMaxEntries

      void setMaxEntries(int numEntries)
      Parameters:
      numEntries - maximum number of entries the console will hold.

    • clear

      void clear()
      Clears all log entries.

    • setSize

      void setSize(int width, int height)
      Set size of the console in pixels
      Parameters:
      width - width of the console in pixels
      height - height of the console in pixels

    • setLoggingToSystem

      void setLoggingToSystem(Boolean log)
      Makes the console also log to the System when log(String) is called.
      Parameters:
      log - to the system

    • setSizePercent

      void setSizePercent(float wPct, float hPct)
      Set size of the console as a percent of screen size
      Parameters:
      wPct - width of the console as a percent of screen width
      hPct - height of the console as a percent of screen height

    • setPosition

      void setPosition(int x, int y)
      Set position of the lower left corner of the console
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate.
      y - Y coordinate.

    • setPositionPercent

      void setPositionPercent(float xPosPct, float yPosPct)
      Set position of the lower left corner of the console as a percent of screen size
      Parameters:
      xPosPct - Percentage for the x position relative to the screen size.
      yPosPct - Percentage for the y position relative to the screen size.

    • resetInputProcessing

      void resetInputProcessing()
      Call this method if you changed the input processor while this console was active.

    • getInputProcessor

      com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor getInputProcessor()
      Returns:
      InputProcessor for this Console

    • draw

      void draw()
      Draws the console.

    • refresh

      void refresh()
      Calls refresh(boolean) with true.

    • refresh

      void refresh(boolean retain)
      Refreshes the console's stage. Use if the app's window size was changed.
      Parameters:
      retain - True if you want position and size percentages to be kept.

    • log

      void log(String msg, LogLevel level)
      Logs a new entry to the console.
      Parameters:
      msg - The message to be logged.
      level - The LogLevel of the log entry.
      See Also:
      • LogLevel

    • log

      void log(String msg)
      Logs a new entry to the console using LogLevel.DEFAULT.
      Parameters:
      msg - The message to be logged.
      See Also:
      • LogLevel
      • log(String, LogLevel)

    • log

      void log(Throwable exception)
      Logs a new entry to the console using LogLevel.ERROR.
      Parameters:
      exception - The exception to be logged

    • log

      void log(Throwable exception, LogLevel level)
      Logs a new entry to the console using LogLevel.
      Parameters:
      exception - The exception to be logged
      level - The LogLevel of the log entry.

    • printLogToFile

      void printLogToFile(String file)
      Prints all log entries to the given file. Log entries include logs in the code and commands made from within in the console while the program is running.

      WARNING
      The file that is sent to this function will be overwritten!

      Parameters:
      file - The relative path to the file to print to. This method uses Files.local(String).

    • printLogToFile

      void printLogToFile(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle fh)
      Prints all log entries to the given file. Log entries include logs in the code and commands made from within in the console while the program is running.

      WARNING
      The file that is sent to this function will be overwritten!

      Parameters:
      fh - The FileHandle that links to the file to be written to. Note that classpath and internal FileHandles cannot be written to.

    • printCommands

      void printCommands()
      Prints all commands

    • printHelp

      void printHelp(String command)
      Prints ConsoleDoc for the given command.
      Parameters:
      command - The command to get help for.

    • isDisabled

      boolean isDisabled()
      Returns:
      If the console is disabled.
      See Also:
      • setDisabled(boolean)

    • setDisabled

      void setDisabled(boolean disabled)
      Parameters:
      disabled - True if the console should be disabled (unable to be shown or used). False otherwise.

    • getDisplayKeyID

      int getDisplayKeyID()
      Gets the console's display key. If the console is enabled, the console will be shown upon this key being pressed.
      Default key is ` a.k.a. 'backtick'.
      Returns:
      the keyID

    • setDisplayKeyID

      void setDisplayKeyID(int code)
      Parameters:
      code - The new key's ID. Cannot be Input.Keys.ENTER.
      See Also:
      • getDisplayKeyID()

    • setCommandExecutor

      void setCommandExecutor(CommandExecutor commandExec)
      Sets this console's CommandExecutor. Its methods are the methods that are referenced within the console. Can be set to null, but this will result in no commands being fired.
      Parameters:
      commandExec - The CommandExecutor to use.

    • execCommand

      void execCommand(String command)
      Executes the specified command via the set CommandExecutor.
      Parameters:
      command - The command to execute.

    • hitsConsole

      boolean hitsConsole(float screenX, float screenY)
      Returns if the given screen coordinates hit the console.
      Parameters:
      screenX - X coordinate on the screen.
      screenY - Y coordinate on the screen.
      Returns:
      True, if the console was hit.

    • dispose

      void dispose()
      Resets the InputProcessor to the one that was the default before this console object was created.

    • isVisible

      boolean isVisible()
      Returns:
      If console is visible

    • setVisible

      void setVisible(boolean visible)
      Hides or shows the console. Same effect as pushing the display button, except it doesn't toggle.
      Parameters:
      visible - If the console should be visible.

    • setExecuteHiddenCommands

      void setExecuteHiddenCommands(boolean enabled)
      Sets the executeHiddenCommands field
      Parameters:
      enabled - - if true, commands annotated with HiddenCommand can be executed

    • setDisplayHiddenCommands

      void setDisplayHiddenCommands(boolean enabled)
      Sets the executeHiddenCommands field
      Parameters:
      enabled - - if true, commands annotated with HiddenCommand show when printCommands (help) is executed

    • isExecuteHiddenCommandsEnabled

      boolean isExecuteHiddenCommandsEnabled()
      Returns:
      If hidden commands can be executed

    • isDisplayHiddenCommandsEnabled

      boolean isDisplayHiddenCommandsEnabled()
      Returns:
      If hidden commands can be displayed

    • setConsoleStackTrace

      void setConsoleStackTrace(boolean enabled)
      Parameters:
      enabled - If the command execution stack traces should be printed to the console.

    • select

      void select()
      Works only for GUIConsole. Selects the text field.

    • deselect

      void deselect()
      Works only for a GUIConsole. Deselects the text field.

    • setTitle

      void setTitle(String title)
      Works only for GUIConsole.
      Parameters:
      title - - The title for the console window.

    • setHoverAlpha

      void setHoverAlpha(float alpha)
      Works only for GUIConsole. Sets the transparency for when the mouse is over the console window.
      Parameters:
      alpha - The transparency (scale from 0 to 1).

    • setNoHoverAlpha

      void setNoHoverAlpha(float alpha)
      Works only for GUIConsole. Sets the transparency for when the mouse is not over the console window.
      Parameters:
      alpha - The transparency (scale from 0 to 1).

    • setHoverColor

      void setHoverColor(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color color)
      Works only for GUIConsole. Sets the color for when the mouse is over the console window. (Resets previous alpha changes).
      Parameters:
      color - The color.

    • setNoHoverColor

      void setNoHoverColor(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color color)
      Works only for GUIConsole. Sets the color for when the mouse is not over the console window. (Resets previous alpha changes).
      Parameters:
      color - The color.

    • enableSubmitButton

      void enableSubmitButton(boolean enable)
      Works only for GUIConsole. Adds a 'Submit' button next to the input field.
      Parameters:
      enable - Whether to show the submit button.

    • setSubmitText

      void setSubmitText(String text)
      Sets the text the submit button should show.
      Parameters:
      text - The text.

    • getWindow

      com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Window getWindow()
      Returns the Console's Window object.
      Returns:
      The window.
